def_cn: (电视、电脑的)屏幕;(电影的)银幕
def_en: See also:big screen; small screen; widescreen; A screen is a flat vertical surface on which pictures or words are shown. Television sets and computers have screens, and films are shown on a screen in cinemas.
You can refer to film or television as the screen .

def_cn: 放映(电影);播放(电视节目)
def_en: When a film or a television programme is screened, it is shown in the cinema or broadcast on television.
A screen is a vertical panel which can be moved around. It is used to keep cold air away from part of a room, or to create a smaller area within a room.
If something is screened by another thing, it is behind it and hidden by it.

def_cn: 检查，筛查(以确定是否患病)
def_en: To screen for a disease means to examine people to make sure that they do not have it.
When an organization screens people who apply to join it, it investigates them to make sure that they are not likely to cause problems.

def_cn: 对(人、行李)进行安全检查
def_en: To screen people or luggage means to check them using special equipment to make sure they are not carrying a weapon or a bomb.

def_cn: 转接，甄别(来电以决定是否接听)
def_en: If you screen your telephone calls, calls made to you are connected to an answering machine or are answered by someone else, so that you can choose whether or not to speak to the people phoning you.
